issue.title: ExecuteDeleteAsync throws ArgumentOutOfRangeException when an owned entity is present and LINQ operators are composed

repository.name: efcore.pg
repository.description: Entity Framework Core provider for PostgreSQL

issue.body:
Had this block of code since EF7 and since upgrading to EF8 it throws the following error, I even added a Count check on the initial query to try to avoid it with no luck. Any insights?

```
foreach (var stepStartDate in dateEnumerable)
{
    var stepEndDate = stepStartDate.Add(step);

    var userIds = await _context.LeaderboardUserSnapshots
        .Where(x => x.Timestamp >= stepStartDate && x.Timestamp < stepEndDate)
        .GroupBy(x => x.UserId)
        .Where(x => x.Count() > 1)
        .Select(x => x.Key)
        .ToArrayAsync();

    foreach (var uid in userIds)
    {
        await _context.LeaderboardUserSnapshots
            .Where(x =>
                x.UserId == uid &&
                x.Timestamp >= stepStartDate &&
                x.Timestamp < stepEndDate)
            .OrderByDescending(x => x.Timestamp)
            .Skip(1)
            .ExecuteDeleteAsync();
    }
}
```


issue.title: Fix SelectExpression cloning when client projections are present

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

body:
Bug summary - ultimately this was a bug in CloningExpressionVisitor, which didn't clone `SelectExpression._clientProjections`. Details:

* When an owned entity is present, nav expansion adds `Select(x => IncludeExpression(...)`.
* TranslateSelect "fails" to translate IncludeExpression, and switches to "client projection" mode; this means that the SelectExpression no longer has `_projectionMapping`, but instead has `_clientProjections`. I'm not clear on why things work this way for IncludeExpression.
* When a complex query happens with ExecuteDelete which cannot be natively supported by the provider (OrderBy().Skip() in the above query), we do a subquery pushdown, doing `DELETE ... WHERE Id IN (...)`.
* That code path embeds the already-translated ShapedQueryExpression inside a synthesized, pre-translated LINQ expression tree, and translates it. Such mixing of pre-translated LINQ Expression nodes with already-translated ones seems problematic.
* When translation reaches the ShapedQueryExpression, it clones it, presumably to prevent referencing the same potentially mutable SelectExpression from two places.
* CloningExpressionVisitor had a bug where it didn't clone the client projections on the SelectExpression. So we ended up with a SelectExpression that has no projection at all.

issue.title: ExecuteDeleteAsync fails when an owned entity exists and the query isn't supported natively (subquery form)

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
## File a bug

I'm running into an unexpected `ArgumentOutOfRangeException` in a library I'm working on. I'm just switching the behavior from loading records in and then deleting them (i.e., `ToListAsync()` then `RemoveRange()` and `SaveChangesAsync()`) to using the new method which should delete everything in one trip to the database (i.e., `ExecuteDeleteAsync` )

### Include your code

Minimal Reproduction: https://github.com/the-avid-engineer/EFCoreBug

It doesn't matter what expression I use, including `.Where(x => true)` - they all throw this exception.

I saw another issue where someone mentions `ArgumentOutOfRangeException` #28137, and they mentioned owned types. I can confirm that this seems related to the `OwnsOne` relationship - the exception is not thrown for `HasOne` nor `OwnsMany`

My package (not this minimal reproduction) uses the Npgsql driver, but the issue persists even if I switch my tests to SQLite, so it doesn't appear to be a driver-specific issue.

### Include stack traces

```
Unhandled exception. System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Index was out of range. Must be non-negative and less than the size of the collection. (Parameter 'index')
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1.get_Item(Int32 index)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.SqlExpressions.SelectExpression.GetProjection(ProjectionBindingExpression projectionBindingExpression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalSqlTranslatingExpressionVisitor.VisitExtension(Expression extensionExpression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalSqlTranslatingExpressionVisitor.BindProperty(EntityReferenceExpression entityReferenceExpression, IProperty property)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalSqlTranslatingExpressionVisitor.TryBindMember(Expression source, MemberIdentity member)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalSqlTranslatingExpressionVisitor.VisitMethodCall(MethodCallExpression methodCallExpression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalSqlTranslatingExpressionVisitor.VisitMethodCall(MethodCallExpression methodCallExpression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalSqlTranslatingExpressionVisitor.TryRewriteEntityEquality(ExpressionType nodeType, Expression left, Expression right, Boolean equalsMethod, Expression& result)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalSqlTranslatingExpressionVisitor.VisitMethodCall(MethodCallExpression methodCallExpression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalSqlTranslatingExpressionVisitor.TranslateInternal(Expression expression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalSqlTranslatingExpressionVisitor.Translate(Expression expression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalQueryableMethodTranslatingExpressionVisitor.TranslateExpression(Expression expression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalQueryableMethodTranslatingExpressionVisitor.TranslateLambdaExpression(ShapedQueryExpression shapedQueryExpression, LambdaExpression lambdaExpression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalQueryableMethodTranslatingExpressionVisitor.TranslateWhere(ShapedQueryExpression source, LambdaExpression predicate)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalQueryableMethodTranslatingExpressionVisitor.TranslateAny(ShapedQueryExpression source, LambdaExpression predicate)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.QueryableMethodTranslatingExpressionVisitor.VisitMethodCall(MethodCallExpression methodCallExpression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalQueryableMethodTranslatingExpressionVisitor.VisitMethodCall(MethodCallExpression methodCallExpression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.QueryableMethodTranslatingExpressionVisitor.TranslateSubquery(Expression expression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalSqlTranslatingExpressionVisitor.VisitMethodCall(MethodCallExpression methodCallExpression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalSqlTranslatingExpressionVisitor.TranslateInternal(Expression expression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalSqlTranslatingExpressionVisitor.Translate(Expression expression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalQueryableMethodTranslatingExpressionVisitor.TranslateExpression(Expression expression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalQueryableMethodTranslatingExpressionVisitor.TranslateLambdaExpression(ShapedQueryExpression shapedQueryExpression, LambdaExpression lambdaExpression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalQueryableMethodTranslatingExpressionVisitor.TranslateWhere(ShapedQueryExpression source, LambdaExpression predicate)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.QueryableMethodTranslatingExpressionVisitor.VisitMethodCall(MethodCallExpression methodCallExpression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalQueryableMethodTranslatingExpressionVisitor.VisitMethodCall(MethodCallExpression methodCallExpression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalQueryableMethodTranslatingExpressionVisitor.TranslateExecuteDelete(ShapedQueryExpression source)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.RelationalQueryableMethodTranslatingExpressionVisitor.VisitMethodCall(MethodCallExpression methodCallExpression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.QueryCompilationContext.CreateQueryExecutor[TResult](Expression query)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.Database.CompileQuery[TResult](Expression query, Boolean async)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Internal.QueryCompiler.CompileQueryCore[TResult](IDatabase database, Expression query, IModel model, Boolean async)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Internal.QueryCompiler.<>c__DisplayClass9_0`1.<Execute>b__0()
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Internal.CompiledQueryCache.GetOrAddQuery[TResult](Object cacheKey, Func`1 compiler)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Internal.QueryCompiler.Execute[TResult](Expression query)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Internal.EntityQueryProvider.Execute[TResult](Expression expression)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.RelationalQueryableExtensions.ExecuteDelete[TSource](IQueryable`1 source)
   at Program.<Main>$(String[] args) in C:\Users\theav\Documents\GitHub\EFCoreBug\Program.cs:line 34
```

### Include provider and version information

EF Core version: 7.0.0
Database provider: Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Sqlite
Target framework: .NET 7.0
Operating system: Windows 11
IDE: Visual Studio 2022 17.4.1

issue.title: Delete_entity_with_auto_include fails on Sqlite/PG

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Tracking issue to investigate what's going on here. 
Exception:

System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException : Index was out of range. Must be non-negative and less than the size of the collection. (Parameter 'index')

```

```

body: @roji we encounter the bug in .NET 8 - is there a backport planned?

Note at the moment - the fix is in an area which changed quite a bit in 9.0, so it's a non-trivial backport, and a relatively edge-case bug... If more users express their need for this, we may take another look at it though.

> Note at the moment - the fix is in an area which changed quite a bit in 9.0, so it's a non-trivial backport, and a relatively edge-case bug... If more users express their need for this, we may take another look at it though.

We have an ugly workaround using the bulkedit package... any chances this could be backported?

Having this exact same problem when using EF-CORE 8. 

I notice that this error only occurs when I try to delete or change an entity that has other entities linked to it. (One to many x many to many)

When it is a simple entity with no links to other entities, everything works well.
